title: Karate Camp 2020
description: The camp date is Friday (Evening) 30th August - Sunday (Noon) 1st September. We will be training at the lovely Waitawheta Camp. Expect fun, games and a lot of training! Sign ups close 28th July midnight

title: Weekend Warriors 2020
description: Weekend Warriors is a club run weekend training camp. This year it will be hosted in Semester 1's mid-semester break

title: Annual General Meeting
description: The club will be having it's Annual General Meeting in September, which involves the election of club exec members. The meeting will be after training and food and beverages will be provided. Please fill out the form if you wish to nominate someone for a position.

title: Pukekohe Karate Tournament
description: The bi-annual Pukekohe Karate tournament is set to have its first event of the year on this April. As usual, kata (solo and teams of at least three) and shiai sparring (point sparring) are on the schedule. There are no pre-requisites for entering the tournament, the club covers entry fees and people with any level of experience are welcome. If you want more details regarding the tournament, feel free to ask us. If you‚Äôre interested in participating then please fill out the sign up form (coming soon).

title: Pukekohe Karate Tournament
description: The bi-annual Pukekohe Karate tournament will have it's second event this September.

title: 2020 National Gasshuku
location: Te Whaea: National Dance & Drama Centre, 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington
description: Sensei Terauchi, 9th Dan, will be visiting Wellington to teach at our 2020 national gasshuku.

title: Terauchi Sensei Dunedin Gasshuku
description: Sensei Terauchi, 9th Dan, will be visiting Dunedin to teach at a gasshuku this February.

title: 41st IOGKF Karate Gishiki
description: The 41st IOGKF Karate Gishiki (Karate Ceremony) is a week long training camp hosted in Okinawa, taught by some of IOGKF's most skilled and highest ranking instructors. More details to come.

title: Semester 1 Grading
location: The Hawks' Nest, Floor 3, 492 Queen Street
description: Our first grading of the year will occur near the end of semester one.

title: Sem 2 Grading
location: The Hawks' Nest, Floor 3, 492 Queen Street
description: Our second grading of the year will occur near the end of semester two.

title: End of Year Beach Training
description: Training at the beach to wrap things up for the year. More details to come.

title: Taira Seminar Pre-Training
location: Pakuranga Goju Ryu, Sunnyhills Primary School
description: Free pre-training before the seminar. Runs from 7pm - 8pm, however feel free to show up from 6pm to do your own thing before the adults training starts.
extendedDescription: Runs form 7pm till 8pm. Covers the core drills that are used in Taira Sensei's teaching method. Hosted by Sennen Sensei at Pakuranga Goju Ryu, Sunnyhills Primary School, Pakuranag. Contact Matt for more details.

title: Taira Sensei Bunkai Seminar
location: Karate Remuera Dojo, 6 Papahia Street, Parnell, Auckland
description: Pakuranga Dojo for the third year have the pleasure again of co-hosting in Auckland one of the greatest exponents of Kata and Application (Bunkai) in the world today. Taira Sensei is well known for his research of the Kata and its true meaning along with his exceptional Kobudo skills. Sensei's Bunkai is based on functionality and practicality, if you've been to one of his Seminars you walk away dazzled by his skill yet always wanting more. Don‚Äôt miss this outstanding opportunity.
extendedDescription:
Pakuranga Dojo for the third year have the pleasure again of co-hosting in Auckland one of the greatest exponents of Kata and Application (Bunkai) in the world today. Taira Sensei is well known for his research of the Kata and its true meaning along with his exceptional Kobudo skills. Sensei's Bunkai is based on functionality and practicality, if you've been to one of his Seminars you walk away dazzled by his skill yet always wanting more. Don‚Äôt miss this outstanding opportunity.
Taira Masaji Sensei (9th Dan) is the chairman of Okinawa Goju Ryu Kenkyukai. Student of Eiichi Miyazato Sensei who was a senior student of Chojun Miyagi Sensei, founder of Goju Ryu Karate.
Taira Sensei will be teaching his unique training methods, focusing on kata applications. The entire seminar will have attendees working in pairs, learning and drilling kata applications, and to train other drills which would support the applications. Come and experience Taira Sensei present the dynamics of Gojuryu kata bunkai and have most of your what-if questions answered.
This 2 day seminar/workshop is open to all styles, and practitioners with a Goju Ryu background will especially benefit.
Last year we had the seminar in two different Dojos, I felt this was too confusing. I could not secure both days at my Dojo again this year, so Sensei Murray has kindly agreed to have this seminar at Remuera Dojo.
Venue:
Saturday 2nd November 2019 12.00pm to 5.00pm (5 hours) 
Sunday 3rd November 2019 12.00pm to 5.00pm (5 hours) 
o	Karate Remuera Dojo, 6 Papahia Street, Parnell.

Cost: $145 total (covering one or both days).
Bank Account details: Pakuranga Goju Ryu Karate.    Kiwibank:  38 9011 0562835 01
Please include ‚ÄòTaira‚Äô as reference along with your name. And also complete the required 2019 Registration Form. :)


More information:
https://www.tairabunkai.co.nz/2019/FAQ.html
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masaji_Taira
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41fqyXZFF74

title: Goju Guys 2020
description: The second Goju Guys seminar is scheduled to happen 2nd-4th of October 2020. A training seminar focusing on ‚ÄòGoju‚Äò karate as presented by practitioners from different Goju schools.  See the Facebook link details.

location: Rissington Girl Guide Camp, Hawke‚Äôs Bay
title: Combined East Coast Goju Ryu November Spring Camp
description: It‚Äôs time to save the dates of Friday 5th November to Sunday 7th November 2021. Great People, Great Food & Great Training! More details to follow.

location: UoA campus, Building 303, Room G15 (303-G15), in the courtyard between Science Buildings 303 and 302.
title: Sem 2 Beginner's Training - Class 1
description: Our free beginner training sessions aim to provide a taste of what Goju-Ryu Karate is all about in an approachable and welcoming environment for all levels of experience. During four sessions we will walk you through some self-defence applications and core techniques of our style of Karate. You may attend any or all of our sessions you are available for; there is no obligation to train every week.
extendedDescription:
Our free beginner training sessions aim to provide a taste of what Goju-Ryu Karate is all about in an approachable and welcoming environment for all levels of experience. During four sessions we will walk you through some self-defence applications and core techniques of our style of Karate. You may attend any or all of our sessions you are available for; there is no obligation to train every week. 

For beginner training, all you need to bring is a drink bottle and wear something that is comfortable to move around/kick/punch in (basically anything but tight jeans). There are bathrooms nearby if you wish to change before/after training. You do not need a uniform/Gi, but if you already have one, feel free to wear it. And don't worry about shoes, we train in bare feet.
